title: So Warwick is now listed on the Champion Rework Schedule site

embed.description: Champion Updates Why do we have updates? Can I have a refund for a updated champion? Upcoming Updates Previous Updates Champion Updates Why do we have updates? A champi...

body:
So I guess we know who the third rework Riot was hoping to get out this year is?

Given that this'll be a VGU, it'll likely be a new kit, in game appearance, new splash arts, VO and lore for Warwick. The question is when?

Also as clarification, the likelihood is that given the needs of the champions, Yorick will be before Warwick and Ryze will be before both of them, provided everything goes according to plan.

They just want everything about him changed so they never have to experience playing against one ever again, although I'm not sure as to why they are so full of hatred towards him.

R.I.P. Warwick. 2009-2016/2017.

If you stay too faithful to a severely outdated kit then you cannot solve the problems of that champion. There are 2 ways things can be now: 
1. WW stays the same, gets no buffs and lies in the dumpster forever.
2. WW gets a major overhaul that gives him meaningful gameplay and more levers for the Live Gameplay team to balance him so that he can still be relevant.

I rather have Warwick be different but relevant.

There's a fine line between staying too faithful and just flat out removing EVERY SINGLE ELEMENT of a champion, including their entire kit, visuals, and voice. I'd be fine if maybe he lost his suppression, but kept his movement speed in some way shape or form, or vice versa, but that's not what they're going to do. They're going to get rid of the healing, the running, the suppression, the voice, the lore, and for the most part, the model. Also, I don't mean altering it heavily, I mean COMPLETELY changing it to the point where if his name isn't Warwick, people would think he's a new fucking champion.

I think you underestimate the design crew there. What would fit a werewolf better than hunting down (read: running) a bleeding (read: low HP) target, locking it down on the ground (read: suppressing) and feasting upon them, regenerating himself (read: healing).

Currently im imagining Warwick to have his current E toggle as either his innate passive or a passive on an ability and his current R as a mixture of Vis Assault and Battery and Volibears Rolling Thunder, an ability where he runs at his target and suppresses it when he reaches it.
And somewhere in that kit will be a form of self sustain for sure.

Poppy still seems to be Poppy for me. You bang people into walls and smack them with a hammer. Okay, Sion got completely changed but honestly he was a total mess of a champion. He was an undead, bulky, shield burst mage with Schwarzenegger lines...and everyone should realize that this was not a sustainable image. But the werewolf theme, the hunting theme, that is a good foundation to build a rework upon.
ooo put plzz tell me will he still be ww in the cines that he chases and heals off of his damage ?
Riot's stated their idea of Warwick is based around this: his blood scent is staying period, he's gonna have sustain, and he's gonna be fairly tanky.

CertainlyT WW:

Passive: Every three hits, WW deals a large amount of max %hp true damage and heals a flat amount that scales with AD. 

Q Passive: The cooldown of Q is reduced by one second after every basic attack
Q: WW Lunges himself at an enemy stunning them, and dealing magic damage scaling with AP and AD. The lunge also cripples them, reducing armor and magic resist.

W Passive: Attacking jungle monsters and champions grants WW stacks of Lunar Menace. Killing or assisting in a champion death automatically grants 100 stacks. These stacks are shown in his resource bar.
W: At 100 stacks, WW howls and gains massive attack speed, movement speed, and on hit %hp magic damage, rapidly consuming the stacks. This ability can be activated again early to heal for an amount scaling with AP, which consumes the buff. 

E passive: WW senses the presence of low hp enemies, granting vision and move speed towards them. Attacks against hunted enemies heal WW on hit and deal a portion of damage as true damage. The amount scales with AD and AP.

R: WW fully embraces his werewolf nature and drops to all fours. During this time, WW can freely move over terrain by climbing walls. The amount of missing hp required for enemies to be hunted is halved, and he gains lunar menace stacks at an increased rate. His q is also set on a fixed cooldown. WW can refresh the duration of this ability by killing an enemy champion. 

Note the total lack of regard for character story, the three hit passive, descriptions the size of textbooks, and extremely overloaded abilities. 

Also, true damage.

I know its pretty early, but could we get some info on the direction of the rework?

Just like what role he will be intended to fill (bruiser, juggernaught, diver, tank, light fighter etc)

As for his design and direction, is there anything you guys are planning with him? For instance, his current design is pretty straightforward, i mean his new splash art is amazing, but hes kind of just this werewolf with some armor.
I guess what i mean is, will his theme change? like going from basic werewolf to hextech werewolf, something more representative to zaun or something else entirely?

Also i think he needs some thematic hook to really distinguish him from other anthropomorphs like nasus and rengar. Nasus is permanently in his werejackal form, and rengar im sure we can assume is from a race of kittymen (unless he is secretly a housecat ascendant?), at first glance one might assume that warwick isnt even a werewolf but perhaps just part of a race of wolfmen, which i feel completely cuts out the core of what his character is, which is a human who paid a price for power that is slowly consuming him, which we could then see why he wants to so desperately cure himself

Personally i would like to see him become a gnar-like transforming champ that starts off in human form and transitions into a beastial werewolf form after being in combat for a time, say after he gets 8 stacks of his passive his next attack has X bonus range and causes him to dash while transforming into a werewolf or something badass like that! I mean what better champ than a werewolf character to be a rage based transformer?
This would also introduce the players to the human side of warwick so that we can get an idea on what the before and after effects of his transformation are, and what he has had to give up to attain his power. also in lore he was a badass man hunter without the transformation, then afterwards is supposed to be even more badass, so it would be great if his werewolf form truly represented that badassery by being his powermode.

Im sure you guys have a ton of ideas already, but i just really wanted you all to consider this direction before its too late!
